# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

Here's the Julia function `wrap_string` that follows your instructions:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text, r"\s+"))
    wrapped_text = ""

    for i in 1:maximum(1:length(words) - text_width), length(words))
        chunk = join(words[i:i+text_width-1]], " ")
        wrapped_text *= "$chunk\n"
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
text = "This is a very long sentence that we will use to demonstrate the wrap_string function."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This example wraps the text with a maximum width of 20 characters.
